net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api

Interface Message

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttributeReadMessage, AttributeReadMessageCode, AttributeReadUuid, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ValidationFailure
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractErrorMessage, AbstractMessage, AbstractValidationFailure, ComposedValidationFailure, ErrorMessage, InformationMessage, ValidationFailureImpl, ValidationFailureSuccess, WarningMessage

    public interface Message
extends Serializable, AttributeReadUuid, AttributeReadMessage, AttributeReadMessageCode
    This is the interface for a message that gets displayed to an end-user.
    Since:
    3.1.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • getSource

        String getSource()
        This method gets the (optional) source of the message. E.g. the name or a field or file that is invalid. It can be used to enrich messages displayed to end-users. This will help to find the problem easier.
        Returns:
        the source or null if NOT available.

      • getMessage

        String getMessage(Locale locale)
        This method gets the message localized for the given Locale.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is designed for server applications with NLS. On client side (e.g. for GWT clients) only a single locale may be supported at a time and this method may behave like AttributeReadMessage.getMessage() ignoring the Locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - is the Locale.
        Returns:
        the message.

      • getDetails

        String getDetails()
        This method gets optional details for this message. E.g. in case of an exception this can be the stacktrace.
        Returns:
        the details or null if no additional details are available.

      • getType

        String getType()
        This method gets the type of this Message. This should be one of the following options:
        • "ValidationFailure" - for a ValidationFailure.
        • "UserError" - for an error caused by the end-user (e.g. by providing invalid data). Unlike TYPE_VALIDATION_FAILURE this is an actual error that has been detected after a successful validation.
        • "TechnicalError" - for an error related to a technical problem (e.g. programming failure such as NullPointerException or operational error like ConnectException).
        • "Warning" - for a warning such as "The hit-list for your query has been truncated."). In such case it should be possible to continue the use-case or operation normally.
        • "Information" - for additional information - e.g. a hint.
        Returns:
        the message type.

      • getUuid

        UUID getUuid()
        This method gets the UUID of this object. When the object is created, a UUID is generated. In case the object is created from another object that already has a UUID, the existing UUID will be used (e.g. for chained exceptions).
        The UUID will appear in a stacktrace but NOT in the message. It will therefore be written to log-files if the NlsThrowable is logged. If you supply the UUID to the end-user in an error panel or popup (see Message), he can provide it with the problem report so an administrator or software developer can easily find the stacktrace in the log-files.
        Specified by:
        getUuid in interface AttributeReadUuid
        Returns:
        the UUID if this Message. Will typically only be available if type is TYPE_TECHNICAL_ERROR or TYPE_USER_ERROR. Will be null if not available.
